com.github.dkharrat.nexusdialog

Class FormActivity

  • java.lang.Object
    • ActionBarActivity
      • com.github.dkharrat.nexusdialog.FormActivity

  • public abstract class FormActivity
extends ActionBarActivity
    FormActivity is the base class for an Activity that uses NexusDialog. It provides simple APIs to quickly create and manage form fields. FormActivity itself inherits from ActionBarActivity, which is a class provided by Google's v7 appcompat library. ActionBarActivity provides ActionBar support on older Android API versions which don't natively support it. If you don't need ActionBar support for your Activity, you can disable it by calling getSupportActionBar().hide() in the initForm() method.

    The form's data is backed by a model represented by FormModel, which provides a generic interface to access the data. Form elements use the model to retrieve current field values and set them upon user input. By default, FormActivity uses a default Map-based model keyed by the element's names. You can also use a custom implementation of a FormModel if desired.
